title: Cup And Saucer, 1779 (cup), 1788 (saucer)
markings:
Underside of cup:  interlaced "L"s / date letter "bb" (for 1779) / painter's mark of Vieillard / gilder's mark of Théodore.
Underside of saucer: interlaced "L"s / date letter "kk" (for 1788) / unrecorded painter's mark "V".
creditline: Museum purchase from Charles E. Sampson Memorial Fund
description: Short, cylindrical cup (a) with scroll handle; light blue enamel and gilded decoration consisting of overlapping semi-circular fan motifs with blue centers and gilded parallel lines, and narrow bands of gold oak leaves on blue diaper ground at mouth and base. Saucer (b) with everted rim decorated en suite with cup.

tombstone.epitaph: Cup And Saucer, 1779 (cup), 1788 (saucer).Porcelain, enamel, gilding. Museum purchase from Charles E. Sampson Memorial Fund. 1983-35-2-a,b.
